DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the average joint motion and joint axis orientation of the hindfoot bones between patients diagnosed with adult-acquired flatfoot disorder (AAFD) and a control group of patients without foot deformity, using weight-bearing CT technology.
DOC.criteria: Symptomatic group: 1. adult patients (ages 18 80 years old) diagnosed with Stage 2 AAFD 1. previous surgery 2. infection 3. tumor in the affected foot 4. pregnancy Control group: 1. adult patients (ages 18 80 years old) without foot deformity 1. history of previous foot and ankle surgery 2. foot deformity 3. known foot and ankle pathology 4. pregnancy
